item.title: Prior and Posterior distributions
item.description: Introduction Let´s suppose that we know all the possible causes for an outcome, for example: ** Bayes theorem Posterior = ( Likelihood * Prior ) / Evidence Here, P(movie|Sci-fi) is called Posterior, P(Sci-fi|Movie) is Likelihood, P(movie) is Prior, P(Sci-fi) is Evidence. Prior: How probable was our hypothesis before observing the evidence? Posterior: How probable is our hypothesis given the observed evidence? Evidence: How probable is the new evidence under all possible hypotheses?
